title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Lafleur Mallet  (Sauternes)
description: Sémillon dominates this rich wine. Spice and honey are balanced by ripe peach and apricot flavors. The acidity cuts right through to give an almost crisp character to this sweet wine. It will develop quickly, so drink from late 2017.

title: College Cellars 2015 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The flower and peach aromas are light but provide plenty of intrigue. It drinks dry with light ale and stone-fruit flavors, showing persistence on the finish.

title: Denario 2010 Reserva Malbec (Río Negro Valley)
description: With little luster in the glass, this mild mossy-smelling Patagonian Malbec is saturated and pinching on the palate, with clamping tannins. Chunky incongruous berry flavors end full but rough, with a note of burnt brown sugar on the finish.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)
description: Earth, leather and herbal aromas blend with riper berry notes on the nose. This feels choppy, with cheek-scraping tannins. Flavors of minty herbal black fruits finish with chocolate, herbal flavors and stickiness.

title: Altavins 2015 Almodí Petit White (Terra Alta)
description: Stony fresh aromas of lime and grapefruit are light and clean. This blend of Garnacha Blanca, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc is steady on the palate. Flavors of dry lime and wet stones are slightly pithy, while this finishes firm and dry.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Reserva do Monte Red (Lisboa)
description: Bright and fruity, this is a ripe, red-fruit-flavored wine. The youthful tannins will soften quickly to give a rounded wine, rich but with crisp acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Castel Boglione 2011  Barolo
description: Subdued aromas suggesting underbrush, scorched earth, leather and dried herb lead the nose. On the medium-bodied rather straightforward palate, hints of baking spice add interest to a core of tart cherry. Drink through 2021.

title: Caves Transmontanas 2011 Vertice Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Ripe red fruits and strong minerality give this wine both its crispness and structure. It has style and elegance, as well as plenty of fruit. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.

title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2014  Bordeaux
description: This is a crisp juicy wine showing the bright red fruits of the vintage. It still has its tannins intact along with plenty of black-currant acidity and a dry aftertaste that will soften over the next few months. Drink from late 2017.

title: Château du Roc 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is a full-bodied wine with generous black-fruit flavors. It has enough acidity to sustain the rich black-currant and blackberry fruits. With its soft tannins and fruity aftertaste, it is ready to drink.

title: Château Haut Beyzac 2014 Classic  (Haut-Médoc)
description: A ripe and fruity wine that has black fruits and intense youthful acidity. It is structured as well, the tannins from the 25% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend are showing firmly. Black currants and blackberries balance with the firm dry core. It will develop and will be ready from 2018.

title: Bishop's Peak 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is bolstered by 11% Petit Verdot, 8% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc. It shows intriguing sandalwood, cedar and macerated blackberry aromas on the nose. There's a touch of beef jerky and plenty of elderberry fruit to the sip as well as a cedary spice.

title: Bodega Norton 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This pumped-up Malbec is black in color and heady on the nose due to oaky aromas on top of stewed plum, blackberry, prune and coconut notes. This feels saturated and sticky, with oak-accented flavors of blackberry, chocolate and coconut. On the finish, this is wearing more than enough oaky makeup.

title: Boyle MacDonald 2013 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Big, tannic and true to type, this wine has flavors like blackberry and black pepper, and a mouthfeel that is dry and somewhat astringent. It will be very good with a hamburger or pork tenderloin.

title: Domenico 2012 Super Tuscan Style Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: This is a well-aged, mature-tasting wine with mild aromas and cedary, savory, almost-meaty flavors on a very firm texture of acidity, tannins and elevated alcohol. It makes a good change of pace.

title: Dr. Heyden 2014 Oppenheimer Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)
description: Juicy black cherry and berry notes are layered in heady tones of char, tobacco leaf and cedar in this easy drinking entry-level Pinot. Ruddy ripeness is balanced out neatly by brisk acidity. It's a tad lean in concentration with a brisk finish.

title: Durigutti 2013 Reserva Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Ripe raisiny aromas of spiced fruit cake are heavy and sweet. Matching the nose, this Bonarda feels thick and chunky with grating tannins. Flavors of chocolaty black fruits are oaky, spicy and minty, while this is equally woody on the finish.

title: Helix by Reininger 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of green wood, vanilla and cola are followed by plump fruit flavors. The palate brings appeal but the aromas don't seem to match up.

title: Kestrel 2012 Falcon Series Estate Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of tire rubber mix with herb, graphite and candied raspberries. The flavors are light and they paint around the edges, with lightly chalky tannins supporting them.

title: Parras Wines 2014 Montaria Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine is rich, full of dark fruits and dusty tannins. It has a solid structure with ripe black fruits and concentration. Wood aging and a dry edge have given the wine a core that will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Pascal Berthier 2015 Esprit de Séduction  (Saint-Amour)
description: This is a rich wine that is full of generous fruit. It has a smooth texture with its broad red-fruit character that is gently lifted by acidity. Ripe and with a soft texture, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Irvine Family Vineyards 2015 Pinot Meunier (Oregon)
description: This is 100% varietal, aged in one-quarter new French oak. It's quite light, perhaps from young vines, with strawberry fruit that might be mistaken (in a black glass) for a rosé. It's tasty and fruity, but without much depth or detail.

title: J. Lohr 2014 Falcon's Perch Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Rounded aromas of baked strawberry, red plum and a touch of graphite show on the nose of this always-solid offering for everyday sipping. Black raspberry and dried sagebrush make for a compelling palate that finishes on a touch of caramel.

title: Jasper Hill 2015 Georgia's Paddock Riesling (Heathcote)
description: Quite a bit different from the more straightforward 2014, this wine features aromas and flavors reminiscent of mushrooms and bruised apples. There's some apparent residual sugar, plus attractive hints of bergamot and honey on the finish.

title: Murphy-Goode 2014 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Well made in a light, easy style, this wine has classic aromas like dried cherry and cinnamon, and dry, appetizing flavors like sour cherry and rhubarb. It will make a great house wine at this reasonable price.

title: My Essential 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Dill-laced blackberries show on the nose of this bottling at first, followed by dust, loam and a touch of tobacco. The palate offers dark cranberry fruit, black peppercorn, dried oregano and lots of earth and dusty elements.

title: Fincas Don Martino 2015 Old Vine Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Gritty plum and berry flavors are a touch rough. This is tight on the palate, but fair. Dry flavors of minty oak and clove are more out front than salty berry notes, while this is firm and tastes like roasted fruit, oak and salted tomato on the finish.

title: François Lurton 2014 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Edgy aromas of tree bark and wiry berry and plum announce a sinewy, fairly tannic palate with rooty, earthy black-fruit flavors. On the finish, a hint of oaky chocolate adds richness to an otherwise jagged, tannic ending.

title: Gear and Sprocket 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is well made, in a light, pale, tart style. The ample acidity boosts sour cherry fruit, keeping the wine sporty and fresh. It would make a fine match to salmon or turkey.

title: Gianni Gagliardo 2012 Serre  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of stalky underbrush, espresso, French oak and camphor lead the nose. The tightly wound palate isn't overly expressive but gives up dried pomegranate, raw sour cherry, oak and a hint of anise alongside bracing tannins that leave an astringent finish.
